column4: Hi everyone, how do I make ubuntu prioritize my wireless network?
It just seems to randomly connect to whatever network it can, that happens to be a slow unsecured one. I'd like it to try conneting to mine first.
once you connect to it once, it should automatically connect to it
if you have multiple ones, try using wifi-radar
So when I disable roaming, how do I select WPA?
It only lets me pick WEP hex and WEP ascii.

click on the wireless network you want to join (when you right click on your little nm-applet in your panel) it should automatically pop up asking you what kind of encryption would you like to use to join
are you sure your card supports WPA?
hmm... have you tried sudo iwlist [interface]  scan ?
I can connect if I pick it myself like you described.
It just switches back to the unsecured one after restarts.
hmm... that is really weird lol... maybe its choosing the unsecured network cause it cant log on to the preferred?
when i choose a WPA, it will automatically ask me to enter in a password for the default keyring, and if it redetects the network, it will ask me for the pass... its not asking you to do that?
hmm thats weird :X im as stumped as you, have you tried forums to see if this problem exists with anyone else?
When I try to connect to it it does ask for a pass.
Nope I didn't try the forums.
